verses.verse: A good name <S%H8034><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than fine <S%H2896><s%> perfume; <S%H8081><s%> and the day <S%H3117><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> better than the day <S%H3117><s%> of one <S%H3205><s%>'s birth.

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of mourning <S%H60><s%> than to go <S%H3212><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of feasting: <S%H4960><s%> for <S%H834><s%> that is the end <S%H5490><s%> of all men, <S%H120><s%> and the living <S%H2416><s%> should take <S%H5414><s%> this to heart. <S%H3820><s%>
Sorrow <S%H3708><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than laughter; <S%H7814><s%> for by the sadness <S%H7455><s%> of the face <S%H6440><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> is made good. <S%H3190><s%>

The heart <S%H3820><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> is in the house <S%H1004><s%> of mourning; <S%H60><s%> but the heart <S%H3820><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> is in the house <S%H1004><s%> of mirth. <S%H8057><s%>
It is better <S%H2896><s%> to hear <S%H8085><s%> the rebuke <S%H1606><s%> of the wise, <S%H2450><s%> than for a man <S%H376><s%> to hear <S%H8085><s%> the song <S%H7892><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
For as the crackling <S%H6963><s%> of thorns <S%H5518><s%> under a pot, <S%H5518><s%> so is the laughter <S%H7814><s%> of the fool. <S%H3684><s%> This also is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>
Surely extortion <S%H6233><s%> makes the wise man <S%H2450><s%> foolish; <S%H1984><s%> and a bribe <S%H4979><s%> destroys <S%H6><s%> the understanding. <S%H3820><s%>

Better <S%H2896><s%> is the end <S%H319><s%> of a thing <S%H1697><s%> than its beginning. <S%H7225><s%> The patient <S%H750><s%> in spirit <S%H7307><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than the proud <S%H1362><s%> in spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
Don't <S%H926><s%> be hasty in your spirit <S%H7307><s%> to be angry, <S%H3707><s%> for anger <S%H3708><s%> rests <S%H5117><s%> in the bosom <S%H2436><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
Don't <S%H559><s%> say, "Why were the former <S%H7223><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> than these? <S%H7592><s%>" For you do not ask wisely about this. <S%H2451><s%>
Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is as good <S%H2896><s%> as an inheritance. <S%H5159><s%> Yes, <S%H3148><s%> it is more excellent for those who see <S%H7200><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

For wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is a defense, <S%H6738><s%> even as money <S%H3701><s%> is a defense; <S%H6738><s%> but the excellency <S%H3504><s%> of knowledge <S%H1847><s%> is that wisdom <S%H2451><s%> preserves the life <S%H2421><s%> of him who has it. <S%H1167><s%>
Consider <S%H7200><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> for who can <S%H3201><s%> make that straight, <S%H8626><s%> which he has made crooked? <S%H5791><s%>

In the day <S%H3117><s%> of prosperity <S%H2896><s%> be joyful, <S%H2896><s%> and in the day <S%H3117><s%> of adversity <S%H7451><s%> consider; <S%H7200><s%> yes, <S%H430><s%> God has made <S%H6213><s%> the one side by side <S%H5980><s%> with the other, <S%H1700><s%> to the end that man <S%H120><s%> should not find <S%H4672><s%> out anything <S%H3972><s%> after him. <S%H310><s%>

All this have I seen <S%H7200><s%> in my days <S%H3117><s%> of vanity: <S%H1892><s%> there is <S%H3426><s%> a righteous <S%H6662><s%> man who perishes <S%H6><s%> in his righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> and there is a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man who lives long <S%H748><s%> in his evildoing. <S%H7451><s%>
Don't <S%H7235><s%> be overly righteous, <S%H6662><s%> neither make yourself overly <S%H3148><s%> wise. <S%H2449><s%> Why should you destroy yourself? <S%H8074><s%>
Don't <S%H7235><s%> be too wicked, <S%H7561><s%> neither be foolish. <S%H5530><s%> Why should you die <S%H4191><s%> before your time? <S%H6256><s%>

It is good <S%H2896><s%> that you should take hold <S%H270><s%> of this. <S%H2088><s%> Yes, <S%H3240><s%> also from that don't withdraw your hand; <S%H3027><s%> for he who fears <S%H3373><s%> God <S%H430><s%> will come forth from them all. <S%H3318><s%>
Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is a strength <S%H5810><s%> to the wise <S%H2450><s%> man more than ten <S%H6235><s%> rulers <S%H7989><s%> who are in a city. <S%H5892><s%>
Surely there is not a righteous <S%H6662><s%> man <S%H120><s%> on earth, <S%H776><s%> who does <S%H6213><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> and doesn't <S%H2398><s%> sin.
Also don't <S%H5414><s%> take heed <S%H3820><s%> to all words <S%H1697><s%> that are spoken, <S%H1696><s%> lest you hear <S%H8085><s%> your servant <S%H5650><s%> curse you; <S%H7043><s%>
for often <S%H6471><s%> your own heart <S%H3820><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> that you yourself have likewise cursed <S%H7043><s%> others. <S%H312><s%>
All this <S%H2090><s%> have I proved <S%H5254><s%> in wisdom. <S%H2451><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> "I will be wise; <S%H2449><s%>" but it was far from me. <S%H7350><s%>
That which is, <S%H7350><s%> is far off and exceedingly deep. <S%H6013><s%> Who can find it out? <S%H4672><s%>

I turned <S%H5437><s%> around, <S%H3820><s%> and my heart sought to know <S%H3045><s%> and to search <S%H8446><s%> out, <S%H1245><s%> and to seek wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and the scheme <S%H2808><s%> of things, <S%H3045><s%> and to know that wickedness <S%H7562><s%> is stupidity, <S%H3689><s%> and that foolishness <S%H5531><s%> is madness. <S%H1947><s%>

I find <S%H4672><s%> more bitter <S%H4751><s%> than death <S%H4194><s%> the woman <S%H802><s%> whose heart <S%H3820><s%> is snares <S%H4685><s%> and traps, <S%H2764><s%> whose hands <S%H3027><s%> are chains. <S%H612><s%> Whoever pleases <S%H2896><s%> God <S%H430><s%> shall escape <S%H4422><s%> from her; <S%H2398><s%> but the sinner will be ensnared by her. <S%H3920><s%>
"Behold, <S%H7200><s%> I have found <S%H4672><s%> this, <S%H559><s%>" says the Preacher, <S%H6953><s%> "one <S%H259><s%> to another, <S%H259><s%> to find out <S%H4672><s%> the scheme; <S%H2808><s%>

which my soul <S%H5315><s%> still seeks; <S%H1245><s%> but I have not found. <S%H4672><s%> One <S%H259><s%> man <S%H120><s%> among a thousand <S%H505><s%> have I found; <S%H4672><s%> but I have not found <S%H4672><s%> a woman among all those. <S%H802><s%>

Behold, <S%H7200><s%> this only <S%H905><s%> have I found: <S%H4672><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> man <S%H120><s%> upright; <S%H3477><s%> but they search for <S%H1245><s%> many <S%H120><s%> schemes. <S%H2810><s%>"
